page.title: 06HOUSING IN A NEW TOWN
page.content: Little land is left rural in this area so housing is a main landcover almost everywhere. Bewbush is soon to be completed with high-density estates. So much has been built since the 1940's you must look hard for older property in Southgate (larger houses), West Green (smaller houses) and Ifield (larger village property). New town housing is almost all two-storey. Few medium or high-rise flats can be found. Unusually for Sussex over half the homes are rented from the council but many are now bought by tenants. The most common are council-built homes in short terraces. Some are semi-detached, or flats. Detached homes are less common, always privately owned and expensive. 1950's houses have no garages,and are built by roads or closes. House groups now cluster in walks and closes.
